creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: front 3/4 view of nude male figure with sash blowing around back; figure holds a spear vertically to the PL side of body; flower at PL foot; decorative foliate design bottom half
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
text: A generation earlier, these fig leaves would have been on the figure, not below him. The graceful nude and fig leaves reflect the continuing influence of Italy north of the Alps. (Figs were not native to Germany.) This print, one of 17 sheath designs by Heinrich Aldegrever, was trimmed to the edges for mounting in an album.
title: Sheath Design with Nude Man
